result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $412.64 to Amberlyn V.  To be paid first.

Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  To be paid after restitution has been satisfied.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Full time employment, or part time employment and school, or fulltime school.
No Contact Order with Amberlyn V.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.
Continue with the Fatherhood Initiative Program.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done.

records.addlTxt: 2/10/16 restitution notice mailed to victim.

Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in court with Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Anjelica R., and defendant. 

-  Court sets Restitution at $412.64 as to Amberlyn V. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  51  months, consecutive to any other sentence -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  15  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  36  months.  

Court finds defendant  IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and   IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Continue with the Fatherhood Initiative Program
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with Amberlyn V.
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $412.64 to Amberlyn V. during the term of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid first.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence,  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in jury room.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Jury panel released.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's offer placed on the record.  Defendant rejects offer; Offer withdrawn.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:35 p.m.  At the hour of 5:00, Court adjourns matter to October 20, 2015 at 9:00 a.m. for continuation of Jury Trial. 
  Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court renders decision, which were placed on the record.  Court denies defense Motion for Suppression/Exclusion.  Matter to remain on the Jury Trial calendar.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Matter calendared for a Decision regarding DNA Testimony and Confrontation Clause.  Decision scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are waiting for revocation decision.  Parties request another final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mariano Deangelo Rodriguez in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for jury trial. Discussion of DNA evidence and the availability of the witness. All motions to be filed regarding this issue by 07/24/2015. Also, new information recently became available to the defense, the defense needs more time to investigate, and requested and adjournment. Court granted defense counsel's request for an adjournment. Discussion of Justice Point report and missed phone contact. Court admonished the defendant. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
